    • Method Detail

      • setHandlers

        protected void setHandlers()
        Set the reference to the macro and data type handler classes

      • setModalDialogReference

        protected void setModalDialogReference(CcddUndoManager undoManager,
                                       CcddJTableHandler table)
        Set the references for the undo manager and table (if applicable) to those of the active modal dialog (e.g., the group manager or macro editor dialogs). Since the modal dialogs lock the user interface while active a reference to them cannot be set for the code to access as it can with the non-modal dialogs (i.e., the table editors and table type editor). The modal undo manager must be set to null after the dialog closes so that the non-modal dialogs (e.g., table and table type editors) undo managers can handle undo/redo operations
        Parameters:
        undoManager - modal dialog undo manager; null to disable
        table - modal dialog table reference; null if the modal dialog has no table

      • setKeyboardHandler

        private void setKeyboardHandler()
        Adjust the handling of Enter and space key inputs in order to activate dialog controls, and keyboard focus changes in order to use the arrow keys like Tab keys

      • getFocusedTableEditorDialog

        private CcddTableEditorDialog getFocusedTableEditorDialog()
        Get the active table editor dialog
        Returns:
        The active table editor dialog; null if no table editor dialog is active or no editor dialog has focus

      • getActiveUndoManager

        private CcddUndoManager getActiveUndoManager()
        Get the active component's undo manager
        Returns:
        The active undo manager; null if no undo manager is active or no editor has focus

      • tableEditCellHandler

        private boolean tableEditCellHandler(java.awt.Component comp)
        Handle Enter and space key press events in a table in order to activate check box controls and initiate editing for editable fields. The space key would do these without this method; it is included in order to eliminate the cell background color 'flash' that occurs when a check box is toggled
        Parameters:
        comp - reference to the component where the key press event occurred
        Returns:
        true if the key press event is handled by this method; false otherwise
